What is the role of the Naming Commission in Pittsburgh?
annotator_a: The Naming Commission in Pittsburgh is responsible for creating guidelines and specifications for naming or changing the name of public property or facilities. They complete a report on the property or facility being named or renamed, which includes its historic, artistic, and cultural background. The Commission meets quarterly and can be contacted for more information by emailing City Planning at cityplanning@pittsburghpa.gov.
annotator_b: Creating guidelines and specifications for naming or changing the name of public property or facilities
